example: A: I go to bed at ten. B: That's early.
They work eight hours a day.
Timothy is often quiet in class.
I'm not a morning person. I never get up before 10 a.m.
We usually have dinner at six.
I seldom see my cousin. He is studying in Poland.
A: Do you eat out? B: Yeah, sometimes.
A: Do you like Alice? B: Alice? I don't even know her.
A: The movie is at 11 p.m. B: Wow, that's late.
My brothers do their homework in the living room.
That video is an hour and twenty minutes long.
Hank is always nervous in front of girls.
The fans are tired after the meet-and-greet.
Ashley is in the shower.
John is never late for school.
By the way, is your sister at home?
Do you often go to the library?
I check out books from the library once a month.
I clean my room once a week.
They walk the dogs twice a day.
We don't walk our dogs every day.

chinese: 我沒辦法。 / 我控制不了。
example: A: You're listening to that song again. B: I can't help it. It's so good.
Wash your hands, and then you can eat.
The table is too small for five people.
A: How often do you say
to your family? B: Not very often.
A: How often do you clean up your room? B: About once a month.
Do you brush your teeth after lunch?
The girl's face is cute.
Some people don't eat breakfast.
The Chen family goes out for lunch on Sundays.
They often exercise at the park after dinner.
Students can't use the computer in class.
A: Can we go in now? B: Please wait a minute. The classroom is not ready.
A: Do you know the answer to this question? B: Sure.
Sherry has a question about her homework.
Mr. Chen's sons often make trouble at school.
I have great friends and family. My life is good.
We have three dogs, and we love them very much.
Ross Lee is not the writer's real name.
